item.title: Proven methods to reduce Azure costs for medium size companies and enterprise clients
item.description:
Table of contents

  • Compute costs
    • Utilize Spot VMs
    • Utilize Burstable VM sizes
    • Use VM Reserved Instances or Savings Plans
    • Reduce Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) costs
  • Backup costs
    • Reduce the amount of data stored through backup policies
    • Utilize the archive tier for VM backups
  • Storage costs
    • Replace Premium managed disks with Standard SSD or Ephemeral where possible
    • Use reservation for larger managed disks
    • Utilize lifecycle and cheaper tiers on storage accounts
    • Take care when enabling Microsoft Defender for Storage
  • Ingestion costs
    • Monitor Azure Defender ingestion rate into Log Analytics Workspace
    • Reduce performance counters collection rate
    • Reduce flow of container logs running in Azure Kubernetes Service
  • Last thoughts

After working with many clients over the years on their Azure cloud adoption journey, I found that cost optimization was an essential part of many projects I was working on. In general, I like to include cost analysis at the proof of concept (POC) stage as sometimes the costs themselves might outweigh the benefits of what we are building once it will scale up.

item.title: Configuring Conditional Forwarding from On-Premise Domain Controller DNS with Azure DNS Private Resolver and AKS
item.description:
Table of contents

  • Create VNet
  • Deploy AKS
  • Create Azure private DNS zone
  • Deploy NGINX ingress controller
  • Deploy External DNS
  • Deploy Sample Appplication
  • Deploy and configure Azure DNS private resolver
  • Configure conditional forwarding from DNS server
  • Test if we can reach AKS service from on-premise
  • Finall thoughts
  • Aditional resources

In this article, we will see how to resolve names of the K8s services running in AKS (Azure Kubernetes Service) from an on-premise desktop or server which is using DNS server running as part Active Directory Domain Controller. The assumption is that the company has a private connection with Azure using offerings like Expressroute.
